content:
Obviously you need to get a wired connection to your router instead of Wifi so you can do your tests I am guessing that is what you missed in your comment here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1460142#answer-1711033 that and the fact that the topic was not yours and as you could not offer any suggestions as to how to fix the other persons issues, your comments were off topic.

The primary reason we ask folk to use safe mode is it gets rid of their added security and antivirus programs as they account for the vast majority of connectivity and speed issues. If you can not use that very convenient mode, you will need to use the startup part of task manager and disable all the startup tasks to get a similar result to do your testing.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The "site" you are seeing is just a static page, and can't block going further. Nor is donating required to go further.

content:
re :As I would like to use the Troubleshooting Mode for Thunderbird, I clicked the appropriate button.

Why do you need to use the Thunderbird Help > Troubleshooting Mode

Which would ask you to click on 'restart' and then ask you click on 'continue in Troubleshoot mode'

Need more info to understand the issue. What Operating system are you using ? What version of Thunderbird are you using? Where did you get the original install of Thunderbird ? eg: Windows app store ? Or the official download from here : https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

When you start up Thunderbird what happens ? What do you see or not see - post an image showing what Thunderbird looks like. If you get an error message post an image of it.
